response.answer_text: dhokla is a steamed delicacy originating from Gujurat it's eaten as a snack or even for breakfast, its healthy: nutritious and low cal as it is steamed usually made a with fermented batter made from gram flour or ground, legumes or rice similar to idly but a lot spongier and comes seasoned with mustard seeds, curry leaves , grated coconut or mustard leaves there are different types of dhoklas based on the ingredients they are made with the most popular is the khaman dhokla which is made of gramflour , sprinkled with sugar water and seasoned with mustard etc dhokla prep requires overnight fermenting so quite a few instant dhokla packs are available in the market for convenience sake

Dhokla is the traditional snack of Gujrath and sometimes it is taken as breakfast too. To make the best Dhokla at home visit Living Foodz. You can get the gujarati dhokla recipe in step by step instruction. Basically dokhla is prepared by mixing besan, water, soda, crushed green chillies and ginger and baking soda. Allow to ferment and steam it and temper with mustard and coriander leaves.
